name: Agoo
description: A coastal and historical municipality, famous for its whistling pine trees, religious heritage, and seaside economy.
history: Founded in 1578 by Juan de Salcedo; early port for Japanese and Chinese traders and later integrated into La Union in 1850.

tourist_spots.name: Basilica Minore of Our Lady of Charity
tourist_spots.description: A revered pilgrimage site known for its centuries-old religious significance and beautiful architecture.

tourist_spots.name: Museo de Iloko
tourist_spots.description: A cultural museum showcasing Ilocano heritage and artifacts.

tourist_spots.name: Lakay Ago
tourist_spots.description: A peaceful escape surrounded by blooming bougainvillea, unique Hobbit House and Mushroom House, and—of course—delicious food made with love

tourist_spots.name: Agoo Eco Park
tourist_spots.description: Popular beaches for swimming, sunset viewing, and local seafood.

festivals: Feast of Our Lady of Charity (May 4)

name: Aringay
description: A town with a rich historical past, lush agricultural lands, and scenic river and coastal views.
history: Originally part of Pangasinan, Aringay was a major trading port before being integrated into La Union in 1850.

tourist_spots.name: Aringay River
tourist_spots.description: A scenic river perfect for kayaking, fishing, and riverside picnics.

tourist_spots.name: St. Lucy Parish Church
tourist_spots.description: A historic church known for its colonial-era architecture and religious significance.

tourist_spots.name: Aringay Beach
tourist_spots.description: A quiet coastal stretch ideal for morning walks, swimming, and seaside relaxation.

specialties: Rice farming and fresh river catch

name: Bacnotan
description: A municipality known for its cement industry, black sand beaches, and academic institutions.
history: Named after the Bacnotan tree; site of early Spanish settlements and home to one of the oldest public high schools in La Union.

tourist_spots.name: Bacnotan Cement Factory Viewpoint
tourist_spots.description: An elevated view of one of the largest cement plants in the region.

tourist_spots.name: Darigayos Beach
tourist_spots.description: A calm beach perfect for sunbathing and shell collecting.

name: Bagulin
description: A mountainous and landlocked municipality known for its indigenous culture, forest trails, and upland farming.
history: Originally settled by the Kankanaey people, Bagulin became a municipality in 1963 through an executive order separating it from Burgos.

tourist_spots.name: Bimmobil Falls
tourist_spots.description: A majestic waterfall ideal for trekking and swimming.

tourist_spots.name: Bagulin Rice Terraces
tourist_spots.description: Man-made rice terraces carved by the local community, reflecting traditional upland farming methods.

name: Balaoan
description: A historical and agricultural municipality known for its sugarcane fields, scenic rivers, and vibrant traditions.
history: One of the oldest towns in La Union, Balaoan was once a major religious center during the Spanish period.

tourist_spots.name: Balaoan Church (St. Nicholas of Tolentine Parish)
tourist_spots.description: A Spanish-era church with a well-preserved bell tower and stone architecture.

tourist_spots.name: Amburayan River
tourist_spots.description: A wide river ideal for kayaking, fishing, and riverside picnics.

name: Bangar
description: The northernmost town of La Union, Bangar is known for its inabel (woven cloth), historic churches, and riverside landscapes.
history: Established during the Spanish colonial era, Bangar became an important religious and weaving center in Northern Luzon.

tourist_spots.name: St. Christopher Parish Church
tourist_spots.description: A Spanish-era church featuring antique altars and relics.

tourist_spots.name: Amburayan River Viewpoint
tourist_spots.description: A scenic riverside spot ideal for fishing, leisure, and photography.

name: Bauang
description: A coastal municipality known for its beaches, grape farms, and historical heritage as a former Spanish garrison town.
history: Founded in the 16th century, Bauang was a major Spanish settlement and an important trading post along the coast.

tourist_spots.name: Bauang Beach
tourist_spots.description: A popular beach destination known for its white sands and sunset views.

tourist_spots.name: Gapuz Grapes Farm
tourist_spots.description: One of the pioneering grape farms in the region, offering tours and fruit picking.

name: Burgos
description: An upland town known for its cool climate, scenic landscapes, and traditional agriculture.
history: Originally a sitio of Naguilian, Burgos became an independent municipality named after martyred priest Fr. José Burgos.

tourist_spots.name: Bulalakaw Falls
tourist_spots.description: A majestic waterfall ideal for trekking and swimming.

tourist_spots.name: Mount Burgos Viewpoint
tourist_spots.description: Offers a panoramic view of the town and surrounding hills, popular with hikers.

name: Caba
description: A peaceful coastal town known for its beach resorts and as the hometown of Philippine revolutionary Diego Silang.
history: Caba was once part of Aringay and became independent during the Spanish period. It played a role during the Philippine revolution.

tourist_spots.name: Diego Silang Monument
tourist_spots.description: A historical marker commemorating the life and heroism of Diego Silang.

tourist_spots.name: Caba Seaside
tourist_spots.description: A stretch of calm beaches ideal for family outings and fishing.

name: Luna
description: A serene coastal town known for its pebble beaches and historic watchtower.
history: Originally known as Namacpacan, Luna was renamed in honor of the Luna brothers, national heroes. It served as a coastal watchpoint during Spanish rule.

tourist_spots.name: Baluarte Watchtower
tourist_spots.description: A Spanish-era watchtower built to guard against pirate raids.

tourist_spots.name: Pebble Beach
tourist_spots.description: A unique beach filled with smooth pebbles, perfect for photography and sunset viewing.

name: Naguilian
description: An inland municipality known for its basi (sugarcane wine) industry and agricultural productivity.
history: Founded as a mission station during the Spanish era, Naguilian became a thriving agricultural town and home of the traditional basi wine.

tourist_spots.name: Basi Wine Processing Center
tourist_spots.description: Showcases the traditional production of basi, a native sugarcane wine.

tourist_spots.name: Naguilian River
tourist_spots.description: A river that provides opportunities for bamboo rafting and riverside picnics.

name: Pugo
description: A scenic upland municipality at the foot of the Cordillera, known for eco-tourism and adventure activities.
history: Pugo, originally a forested area, developed as a community for settlers from nearby provinces. Its name means 'islet' in Ilocano, referring to its elevated location.

tourist_spots.name: PUGAD (Pugo Adventure Park)
tourist_spots.description: An eco-adventure park offering zip lines, wall climbing, ATV rides, and river swimming.

tourist_spots.name: Tapuakan River
tourist_spots.description: A pristine river known for its crystal-clear waters, natural pools, and rock formations.

name: Rosario
description: The southern gateway to La Union, known for its forests, caves, and being a historical transportation hub.
history: Rosario was once a forested area inhabited by Aetas and Ilocano settlers. It became an important transport town during the Spanish period due to its location along major roads.

tourist_spots.name: Marcos Park and Nature Trail
tourist_spots.description: A peaceful park named after former President Marcos, featuring trails, picnic areas, and native flora.

tourist_spots.name: Lomboy Cave
tourist_spots.description: A cave system with limestone formations, ideal for beginner spelunkers and adventurers.

name: San Fernando
description: The capital and center of commerce, culture, and governance in La Union, blending urban life with historical and beach attractions.
history: Established in 1786, San Fernando became the provincial capital of La Union in 1850. It played vital roles in the Spanish and American colonial periods and World War II.

tourist_spots.name: Ma-Cho Temple
tourist_spots.description: A Taoist temple honoring the Chinese sea goddess Mazu, offering panoramic views and cultural immersion.

tourist_spots.name: Pindangan Ruins
tourist_spots.description: Remnants of a 17th-century church, one of the earliest religious structures in the region.

tourist_spots.name: Pagoda Hill
tourist_spots.description: A hilltop with a pagoda offering panoramic views of the city and the sea.

name: San Gabriel
description: An upland town with lush forests and waterfalls, a haven for eco-tourists and nature lovers.
history: Founded in the 1800s, San Gabriel has long been home to indigenous groups like the Kankanaey and remains a quiet rural town rich in natural resources.

tourist_spots.name: Tangadan Falls
tourist_spots.description: One of the most famous waterfalls in La Union, accessible via a scenic hike and perfect for swimming.

tourist_spots.name: Lon-oy Springs
tourist_spots.description: A major water source supplying nearby towns, located in a protected and scenic forest area.

name: San Juan
description: Known as the Surfing Capital of Northern Luzon, San Juan is a vibrant coastal town drawing surfers and beachgoers from across the country.
history: Founded as a Spanish mission in the 1700s, San Juan has grown from a quiet fishing town into a booming tourism hotspot, especially for surfing.

tourist_spots.name: Urbiztondo Beach
tourist_spots.description: A world-class surf destination with consistent waves and a lively tourism scene.

tourist_spots.name: San Juan Beach Boardwalk
tourist_spots.description: A scenic beachfront walk with cafés, shops, and ocean views perfect for sunset watching.

tourist_spots.name: St. John the Baptist Church
tourist_spots.description: A historical church with Spanish colonial architecture, the center of religious life in the town.

festivals: Feast of St. John the Baptist (June 24)

name: Sudipen
description: A serene upland town at the northernmost tip of La Union, Sudipen boasts lush rivers, mountains, and a strong indigenous identity.
history: Sudipen was officially organized in 1906 and was originally inhabited by indigenous peoples, primarily the Kankanaey and Ibaloi groups.

tourist_spots.name: Amburayan River
tourist_spots.description: A scenic river perfect for eco-trips, bamboo rafting, and viewing the mountainous terrain.

tourist_spots.name: Mount Kimmalagong
tourist_spots.description: A hidden hiking trail offering panoramic views and biodiversity.

name: Sto. Tomas
description: A coastal municipality in southern La Union known for its black sand beaches, dried fish industry, and local festivals.
history: Established during the Spanish period, Sto. Tomas grew as a fishing town and was later incorporated into La Union upon the province's creation in 1850.

tourist_spots.name: Damortis Black Sand Beach
tourist_spots.description: A peaceful stretch of dark volcanic sand, ideal for beach walks and picnics.

tourist_spots.name: Dried Fish Market
tourist_spots.description: A bustling public market where visitors can buy various types of locally processed dried fish.

tourist_spots.name: St. Thomas Aquinas Parish Church
tourist_spots.description: The central Catholic church of the town, showcasing colonial architecture and religious traditions.

name: Tubao
description: A serene inland municipality of La Union known for its fertile lands, historical sites, and scenic mountain views.
history: Tubao was officially founded in the mid-19th century and is historically an agricultural community. It played roles during both the Spanish and American periods, particularly as a local trade hub due to its strategic valley location.

tourist_spots.name: Mount Kimmalogong
tourist_spots.description: A favorite among local hikers, this mountain offers panoramic views of La Union’s interior.

tourist_spots.name: St. Isidore the Farmer Parish Church
tourist_spots.description: A historic Catholic church built in honor of the patron saint of farmers, reflecting the town’s agricultural roots.

tourist_spots.name: Agno River Viewpoint
tourist_spots.description: A peaceful riverside area ideal for rest and photography along the border with Pangasinan.
